result.execSummary:
The defendant Kendrae D Buie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all court costs, fees and surcharges, mandatory DNA surcharge.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.  Bail to apply to both 14CF404 and 14CF1017.

Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to any other sentence.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING  (28 pages) commencing MAY 8, 2014 received and filed.
Check # 328917 printed on 05/30/14 was returned by the USPS no forwarding address. AR

THIS NOTATION IS TO CLARIFY 05-08-2014 COURT RECORD SENTENCING PORTION.
In lieu of Conditions of Probation, it should read.
CONDITIONS: 
-obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation;
-pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-pay MANDATORY DNA surcharge; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.

SENTENCE IN THIS MATTER DOES NOT CONTAIN PROBATION.
bmb
Of Right To Seek Postconviction Relief, FILED.

Defendant Kendrae D Buie in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Kendrae D Buie in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

AS TO COUNT 1, Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

AS TO COUNT 2:  DISMISSED

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the state, defense counsel and defendant. 
Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION, CONCURRENT TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE. Credit for 59 days time served. 
-
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
-obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation;
-pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-pay MANDATORY DNA surcharge; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
-
-  Payment Plan for all monetary obligations to be established by Department of Corrections, Probation and Parole.  All unpaid balances at the end of the probationary period will convert to a civil judgment.
-  Civil Judgment Warning given.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter.  
-  Cash Bail in the amount of $3000.00, posted on 02-16-2014 in case 14CF404 is to be applied to restitution/all monetary obligations in both 14CF404 and 14CF1017.  Any amounts remaining after application to restitution/all monetary obligations in both cases is to be returned to person posting bail.

Appeal rights given. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. Copy given to defendant.

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Kendrae D Buie not in court, in custody.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Due to Jury Trial taking place in Branch 22, Plea and Sentencing adjourned to a later date in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-08-2014 at 08:30 am.
FILE REMAINS IN COURTROOM PENDING PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING.

Defendant Kendrae D Buie in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Kendrae D Buie in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Mladen Dukic-MPD Officer.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #14CF404 that are attached to the complaint.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Kendrae D Buie in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Kendrae D Buie in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty as to misdemeanor count 1.
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
